summary: This document provides information regarding the timestamping of call detail records maintained by T-Mobile US, Inc. It explains the difference between Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) and local time zones, and how call records are stored and presented in legal demands. The document serves as a notice for understanding the time format of call records.
keyFacts: The document discusses the storage and maintenance of call detail records by T-Mobile US, Inc.
Call detail records are stored in UTC, which is a time standard independent of local time zones.
Older call records are maintained in the time zone associated with the user's location at the time of the call.
The document provides resources for converting UTC to local time.
It includes a contact email for inquiries regarding the notice.
